newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Gold Bridge wins property contract.
newsitem.headline: Gold Bridge wins property contract.

text.p: Gold Bridge Engineering & Construction Bhd said it has been awarded a contract to design and build a 680 million ringgit residential and recreational development in western Negeri Sembilan state.

The Emerald Coast project when completed in three years' time will include residential areas in a marina setting, the civil and construction firm said in a statement to the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange.
The 200-acre tourism project was awarded by private firm Liberty Bay Sdn Bhd and its joint venture partner Perbadanan Menteri Besar, a firm owned by the Negeri Sembilan state government.

"The whole project is expected to take five years to complete and Gold Bridge is projecting a gross profit of 12 percent or 82 million ringgit for the duration of the contract period," the statement said.
Gold Bridge expects total sales from the project to be in excess of one billion ringgit.
The company asked the stock exchange to extend the suspension of its shares, saying it was still in the final of negotiations of a corporate exercise.
The stock was last traded on June 20 at 11.70 ringgit.
